metadata.Title: CVE-2023-4012 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
ntpd will crash if the server is not NTS-enabled (no certificate) and it receives an NTS-enabled client request (mode 3).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4012` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ntpsec - 1.2.2+dfsg1-2
ntpsec-ntpdate - 1.2.2+dfsg1-2
ntpsec-ntpdig - 1.2.2+dfsg1-2
ntpsec-ntpviz - 1.2.2+dfsg1-2
python3-ntp - 1.2.2+dfsg1-2
No subscription required

ntp - 1.2.2+dfsg1-2
ntpdate - 1.2.2+dfsg1-2
sntp - 1.2.2+dfsg1-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ntpsec package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.2+dfsg1-2').
